p: On the 14th day, a tissue sample from the site of the wound was taken from all animals of both excision and incision wound models and was sent for histological study. Samples were fixed in 10% buffered formalin. Further, tissue processing included dehydration, wax impregnation, and preparation of blocks with paraffin. Sectioning was done on a microtome (3â€“5 micron thick), and hematoxylin and eosin were used for the staining. Epidermis, bacterial colonies, and inflammation were the parameters visualized in all the four groups of both the models, i.e., excision and incision [ 53].
